title: Relates to requiring parking garages to install and operate pedestrian warning devices where vehicles exiting such garage cross a pedestrian sidewalk
summary: Relates to requiring commercial parking garages to install and operate pedestrian warning devices where vehicles exiting such garage cross a pedestrian sidewalk; requires both visual and audible warning signals.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         4088

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   February 1, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. KAVANAGH -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Transportation

       AN  ACT  to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to pedestrian
         warning devices for parking garages

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  vehicle  and  traffic law is amended by adding a new
    2  section 1686 to read as follows:
    3    S 1686. ALL VEHICLES MUST STOP AT PARKING GARAGE EXITS. (A) AS USED IN
    4  THIS SECTION, THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL HAVE THE FOLLOWING MEANINGS:  1.
    5  "EXIT"  SHALL  MEAN  A POINT OF EGRESS OF A MOTOR VEHICLE WHICH REQUIRES
    6  SUCH MOTOR VEHICLE TO CROSS A SIDEWALK.
    7    2. "PARKING GARAGE" SHALL MEAN A BUILDING OR THAT PORTION OF A  BUILD-
    8  ING  DESIGNED  OR  USED FOR THE HOUSING, STORAGE OR PARKING OF TWENTY OR
    9  MORE MOTOR VEHICLES.
   10    3. "PEDESTRIAN  WARNING  DEVICE"  SHALL  MEAN  ANY  DEVICE  OR  SYSTEM
   11  CONSISTING OF A MECHANISM WHICH DETECTS A MOTOR VEHICLE AS IT APPROACHES
   12  A  PARKING  GARAGE  EXIT  TO  DEPART  THEREFROM AND ACTIVATES A FLASHING
   13  YELLOW LIGHT POSITIONED AT THE EXTERIOR  OF  SUCH  PARKING  GARAGE  EXIT
   14  WHICH IS VISIBLE TO PEDESTRIANS AND AN AUDIBLE WARNING SIGNAL CONSISTING
   15  OF  AN  INTERMITTENT  SOUND  NOT  EXCEEDING  70  DB  (A) MEASURED AT, OR
   16  ADJUSTED TO, A DISTANCE OF TEN FEET FROM SUCH EXIT.  SUCH  DEVICE  SHALL
   17  NOT  BE  ACTIVATED FOR ANY PERIOD OF TIME IN EXCESS OF TEN SECONDS AFTER
   18  THE ACTIVATING VEHICLE HAS CLEARED THE EXIT, EXCEPT AS  ACTIVATED  BY  A
   19  SUBSEQUENT VEHICLE.
   20    (B)  ALL  OWNERS OF PARKING GARAGES SHALL INSTALL, AT EACH EXIT THERE-
   21  FROM:
   22    1. A PEDESTRIAN WARNING DEVICE;
   23    2. A STOP SIGN;

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00834-01-1

       A. 4088                             2

    1    3. THE FOLLOWING NOTICE IN A MANNER WHICH IS LEGIBLE  AND  CONSPICUOUS
    2  TO  OPERATORS OF EXITING MOTOR VEHICLES: "STATE LAW REQUIRES VEHICLES TO
    3  YIELD THE RIGHT OF WAY TO PEDESTRIANS ON SIDEWALKS."; AND
    4    4. ON THE EXTERIOR OF EACH SUCH EXIT THE FOLLOWING NOTICE TO PEDESTRI-
    5  ANS:  "CAUTION:  EXITING  VEHICLES."  SUCH  NOTICE  SHALL BE POSTED IN A
    6  MANNER WHICH IS LEGIBLE AND CONSPICUOUS TO PEDESTRIANS.
    7    (C) A VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE PUNISHABLE BY A FINE OF UP TO
    8  TWO HUNDRED FIFTY DOLLARS FOR EACH VIOLATION.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   10  it shall have become a law.
